item.title: Nefer Team Composition Guide In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Dendro characters have some of the best reactions in Genshin Impact . Their reactions got even better with the release of Nod Krai and the addition of Lunar reactions. For Nefer, she triggers a Lunar Bloom reaction if her team has a Hydro character to apply their element. As a character who deals DMG on the field, Nefer additionally needs off-field characters, even Dendro ones, as long as they increase her DPS. Here are the best teams for Nefer in Genshin Impact , including her premium and F2P options.

Nefer Team Comp In Genshin Impact

Based on her kit and her constant need for Lunar Bloom reactions, it's hard to include Nefer in any Hyperbloom team in Genshin Impact . Characters like Ineffa would constantly compete with Nefer over Aino's Hydro application, which would reduce both of their DMG. It's also not ideal to remove Lauma from Nefer's best team in Genshin Impact , because that will cost her an insane amount of DPS. So, the best solution is to stick with exclusive Dendro and Hydro teams for Nefer. Here are some of Nefer's best teams in Genshin Impact .

  • Nefer premium team: Nefer + Aino + Lauma + Nilou
  • Nefer F2P team: Nefer + Aino + Xingqiu + Dendro MC

Nefer + Aino + Lauma + Nilou

If you want Nefer to always perform at her best, it's necessary to always include Lauma in her teams. It's more important than going for Nefer's C1 or getting her Signature weapon. Lauma has the ability to notably lower enemies' resistance to Dendro while massively increasing the DMG of Lunar Bloom reactions. She also buffs the Crit value of Lunar Bloom reactions, which is another reason why Lauma is a perfect pair with Nefer in Genshin Impact.

As for the rest of the team, Nefer's team needs a Hydro user to help trigger the lunar Bloom reactions. One of the best options is Aino , as she's a Nod Krai character who provides great off-field Hydro application. Additionally, Aino gets better as a support in Genshin Impact with her first and last constellation. The first constellation increases the team's Elemental Mastery by 80, while C6 Aino buffs the team's Lunar Bloom DMG.

Finally, the last spot in Nefer's team is more of a flex spot, as the team is already dealing incredible DMG with Nefer, Aino, and Lauma. Nilou is always good with exclusive Dendro and Hydro teams, as she replaces their Bloom reactions with Bountiful Blooms that deals much more DMG based on Nilou's HP. She's also one of the best Hydro enablers while barely taking any field time. You can replace Nilou with Sucrose , who offers the team a lot of Elemental Mastery when she Swirls Aino's Hydro. You can also replace her with a third Dendro character like Nahida or Baizhu , who also offer major buffs to Elemental Mastery and Dendro reactions in Genshin Impact . In the end, it's worth noting that C2 Nahida is the best character to occupy the 4th flex spot in Nefer's teams, as she would do wonders with all the extra Crit value the team has from all 5-star characters in Genshin Impact .

Nefer + Aino + Xingqiu + Dendro MC

Losing Lauma is a major loss for Nefer, but any 5-star character does less DMG when losing their best pairs in Genshin Impact . However, Aino is still here to increase the team's Moonsign level to Ascendant Gleam. Since Nefer and her team need to trigger as much Lunar Bloom as possible, it's better to include characters like Xingqiu and Dendro Traveler who can constantly apply their elements while not on the field. It's important to include another Dendro character, as Nefer is already losing a lot of buffs. So, having the Dendro Resonance's Elemental Mastery buff is going to make it up a little.

It's important to note that Xingqiu doesn't fully work with Nefer, as she deals DMG through her Charged attacks, while Xingqiu follows up with Hydro attacks when the active character uses their Normal attacks. Yet, he can still enable Hydro when Nefer contacts enemies. Not to mention, you can always sneak a Normal attack before using Nefer's combo.

236
9.2 /10
8 /10

Genshin Impact

item.title: How To Build Nefer In Genshin Impact (Best Weapons, Artifacts, And Constellations)
item.description:
Nefer is a playable Dendro Catalyst user in Genshin Impact . Just like the other 5-star Nod Krai characters, Nefer can also produce Lunar reactions during combat. When Nefer or her team triggers a Bloom reaction, Nefer transforms it into Lunar Bloom, which makes it have different mechanics than the ordinary Bloom. To make the most of her gameplay and kit, here's how to build Nefer in Genshin Impact , including her best weapons, artifacts, and constellations.

Nefer Build Overview In Genshin Impact

Weapons

  1. Reliquary of Truth
  2. Nightweaver's Looking Glass
  3. Dawning Frost
  4. Blackmarrow Lantern
  5. Sacrificial Fragments
  6. The Widsith

Artifact Sets

  • Night of the Sky's Unveiling

Stats

  • Timepiece: Elemental Mastery
  • Goblet: Elemental Mastery
  • Circlet: Elemental Mastery or Crit DMG

Substats

  1. Elemental Mastery
  2. Crit DMG
  3. Crit Rate

Best Nefer Weapons In Genshin Impact

Weapon

Why It's Good

Reliquary of Truth

Reliquary of Truth slightly increases Nefer's Crit Rate while granting her a lot of Elemental Mastery from its passive effect. More importantly, Nefer gets a great amount of Crit DMG from Reliquary of Truth's passive and substat, which greatly helps with her build. Unsurprisingly, these effects perfectly fit Nefer's gameplay, as Reliquary of Truth is her Signature weapon and her Best-in-slot.

Nightweaver's Looking Glass

Lauma's best weapon is one of Nefer's best Catalysts in Genshin Impact . It offers her a massive amount of Elemental Mastery, on top of increasing all of her Lunar Bloom reactions.

Dawning Frost

Most of Nefer's gameplay revolves around using her Charged attack after casting her Elemental Skill. That makes Dawning Frost a great 4-star option for Nefer since it increases her Elemental Mastery every time she uses her Charged attacks or Elemental Skill. Not only that, but Dawning Frost also has a Crit DMG substat, which further increases its value for Nefer.

Blackmarrow Lantern

Going into Nefer's best F2P weapons in Genshin Impact , Blackmarrow Lantern offers a decent chunk of Elemental Mastery and Lunar Bloom DMG for a free Catalyst.

Sacrificial Fragments

Sacrificial Fragments is also a good weapon for Nefer since it grants her Elemental Mastery, on top of allowing her to use her Elemental Skill one extra time.

The Widsith

Finally, you can't play a gacha game without going all in on the RNG. Other than giving her Crit DMG, the Widsith is not really a good weapon for Nefer, unless you hit the Interlude theme song, which grants Nefer a whopping 480 Elemental Mastery. Then, it's one of Nefer's best weapons, for like 10 seconds.

Best Nefer Artifacts In Genshin Impact

One of the main reasons why you should build Nefer with full Elemental Mastery (EM) stats in Genshin Impact is that her kit heavily depends on it. Her best DPS talents and passives greatly scale with Elemental Mastery, which increases EM's value over Crit. Not only that, but Nefer also gets tons of Crit value from her best weapons and artifacts, which makes it easier to focus more on getting her to 1000 Elemental Mastery.

Artifact Set

Why It's Good

Night of the Sky's Unveiling

Night of the Sky's Unveiling is the perfect artifact set for Nefer, to the point it's a must-have for Nefer's build in Genshin Impact . Without the Night of the Sky's Unveiling set, Nefer loses a lot of her DPS.

Starting from the 2-piece effect, Nefer gets 80 Elemental Mastery. It's the most important stat for her, so it's always good to increase it.

As for the 4-piece effect, it massively increases Nefer's Crit Rate up to 30%. That makes it extremely easy to stack Crit DMG and Elemental Mastery on Nefer when building her. The 4-piece effect also increases her Lunar Bloom reaction, which is another reason why Night of the Sky's Unveiling is a must-have for Nefer's build in Genshin Impact .

Nefer Constellations In Genshin Impact

Constellation

Effect

Importance

C1

Planning Breeds Success

The Base DMG for Lunar-Bloom reactions caused by Nefer's Phantasm Performance is increased by 60% of her Elemental Mastery. This effect is also boosted by Veil of Falsehood.

High

C2

Observation Feeds Strategy

Enhances the effects of the Ascension Talent A Wager of Moonlight: Extends Veil of Falsehood's duration by 5s, and increases its stack limit to 5, as well as causing Phantasm Performance to deal up to 140% of its original DMG. When Nefer unleashes her Elemental Skill, she will instantly gain 2 stacks of Veil of Falsehood. Additionally, when Veil of Falsehood gains 5 stacks, or when the fifth stack's duration is refreshed, Nefer's Elemental Mastery will be increased by 200 for 8s instead.

You must first unlock the Ascension Talent "A Wager of Moonlight."

High

C4

Delusion Ensnares Reason

When Nefer is on the field and in the Shadow Dance state, you will gain Verdant Dew 25% faster. Additionally, while Nefer is in the Shadow Dance state, nearby opponents will have their Dendro RES decreased by 20%. This effect will be removed when Nefer exits the Shadow Dance state or after she strays a certain distance away from the opponents for 4.5s.

High

C6

Victory Flows from the Turning of Tides

When Nefer unleashes Phantasm Performance, the second stage of DMG dealt by herself will be converted to deal AoE Dendro DMG equal to 85% of her Elemental Mastery. Additionally, when the attacks from Phantasm Performance end, an extra instance of AoE Dendro DMG equal to 120% of Nefer's Elemental Mastery will be dealt. All of the aforementioned DMG is considered Lunar-Bloom DMG dealt by Phantasm Performance.

Moonsign: Ascendant Gleam

Nefer's Lunar-Bloom DMG is elevated by 15%.

Priority

236
9.2 /10
8 /10

item.title: Best Games For Living Out Your Ultimate Power Fantasy
item.description:
Some games are all about the struggle. They have players just scraping by, desperately clinging to a few scraps of health and hope, and that’s fine. It's great, even. But then there are the other ones.

The ones that just hand players the keys to the godhood throne and tell them to go absolutely wild. These are the games that understand that primal, reptilian-brain joy of just letting one unleash pure, unadulterated chaos with style. Of letting players break right past what should be possible and just live out incredible scenarios where their strength is completely, totally unmatched. These are games that don't just let the player be powerful. They make them feel genuinely, properly unstoppable.

Saints Row 4

Where Superpowers And Utter Chaos Go Hand In Hand

Saints Row 4
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
August 20, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Volition
Powered by

This game replaces all that boring, grounded stuff with super speed, telekinesis, and a huge simulated city that is just begging to wreak glorious, beautiful havoc in it. Players take control of the Boss of the Saints, who is also the President of the United States, and quickly discover that they've been trapped in an alien simulation. So, what’s the solution? Become a superhero, of course. And tear the whole thing apart from the inside.

Gliding gracefully across the rooftops, running faster than a speeding car, and dropkicking aliens into the stratosphere...this game is a glorious, open-world superhero fever dream. And it just doubles down on the absurdity at every single turn. Few games have ever embraced the power fantasy with this much confidence.

Prototype

The Power To Consume, And To Become

Prototype
8.9 /10
Released
June 9, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Radical Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

Being a monster has never been this fun. Prototype features Alex Mercer as the protagonist, a man infected with a horrifying, shape-shifting virus that gives him abilities that are as deeply unsettling as they are satisfying. He can consume his enemies to literally take their appearance and leap over skyscrapers. He can slice tanks clean in half with his giant, bladed arms.

The entire city of New York becomes a personal, gory playground as players unravel a dark conspiracy and just leave a trail of beautiful, beautiful destruction in their wake. The best part is just how tactile, how visceral all of the powers feel. Grabbing a soldier and just hurling them across the street into a bus...it just never stops being fun.

Doom Eternal

A Demon’s Worst Nightmare

DOOM Eternal
9 /10
12
8.8 /10
Released
March 20, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Developer(s)
id Software
Powered by

Doom Eternal is an absolute, undisputed masterclass in turning the player into the apex predator. From the very first, thumping, heavy-metal-infused moment players step into the first level, the game demands aggression. It demands forward momentum and rewards fans by making them even stronger.

Health, ammo, and armor all flow out of enemies, fueling this beautiful, perfect loop of violence that keeps players constantly, relentlessly on the attack. Every weapon feels like a piece of an unstoppable, god-like arsenal, erasing demons from existence.

God Of War: Ragnarok

The Quiet, Controlled Wrath Of A God

God of War Ragnarok
10 /10
76
9.1 /10
Released
November 9, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Santa Monica Studio
Powered by

Kratos might have been a screaming, rage-fuelled engine of destruction in the original trilogy. But in Ragnarok , it's different. More controlled. More deliberate. But don't dare to think that that means he's any less powerful. Oh no.

Every single swing of the Leviathan Axe carries this incredible, ground-shaking weight, and the deeply satisfying thunk it makes when he recalls it back to his hand never gets old. The story builds this fantasy even further, giving Kratos a deeply personal stake as he fights gods, monsters, and destiny itself. A beautiful, brilliant, and surprisingly emotional power fantasy.

Devil May Cry 5

Staying Stylish To The Very End

Devil May Cry 5
10 /10
14
8.9 /10
Released
March 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Powered by

This game doesn't just let the player be powerful. It challenges them, it dares them, to be stylish about it. Playing as Dante, Nero, and V, and pulling off these absolutely absurd, reality-bending combos that will juggle demons in the air for longer than physics should possibly allow. And every single S-rank feels like a personal, hard-won reward for the player's own creativity.

The game’s incredible flair for pure spectacle just helps to sell the power trip. Motorcycles become weapons. Devil triggers will turn the characters into a walking hurricane of demonic energy. It’s a game that just lets players look impossibly, ridiculously cool while they are doing impossible, ridiculous things.

Infamous: Second Son

Good, Evil, And Absolutely Overpowered

inFAMOUS Second Son
8 /10
8.4 /10
Released
March 21, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Powered by

Delsin Rowe is a man who gains the incredible ability to absorb the powers of other "Conduits." And that just gives the player an incredible, rotating arsenal of superhuman abilities to play with. Neon, smoke, video, and concrete - each new power set they unlock completely changes how they traverse and how they fight their way across the beautiful city of Seattle.

The morality system ties so perfectly into the power fantasy, with good and evil choices unlocking different, equally devastating upgrades. Either be a heroic, beloved savior, or you can be an unstoppable, feared menace. But either way, the players feel like the most powerful person in the city.

Asura's Wrath

When Punching Becomes A Religion

Asura's Wrath
9 /10
10 /10
Released
February 21, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
CyberConnect2
Powered by

This game is just ridiculous in the best possible way. Asura’s Wrath takes the very concept of a power fantasy and cranks it past eleven. And then it breaks the dial. And then it sets the dial on fire. Players take control of Asura, a demigod who has been betrayed by his peers, and he spends the entire game just...punching. Punching his way through gods, deities, and planet-sized enemies to get his revenge.

This isn't really a traditional game; it's more like an interactive, over-the-top anime. But the sheer, mind-bending, cosmic scale of its action is unmatched. This is a game where the main character punches a guy so hard that it pierces the moon. A game where players fight a deity whose finger is the size of a continent. It is unapologetically ridiculous.

item.title: All Wild Zone 15 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Wild Zone 15 is one of the trickiest areas in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , as it is home to one of the most elusive Pokemon in the game: Larvitar. Those hoping to obtain a Larvitar to get 100% completion may find themselves frustrated, as it can be difficult to find unless you know exactly where to look.

This guide covers the locations of all Pokemon in Wild Zone 15, the best routes to reach their hiding spots, as well as all prerequisites players will need to do before they become available. Here's the breakdown.

Wild Zone 15 unlocks after you have completed Main Mission 19 : Reaching Rank D.

All Wild Zone 15 Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A & Where to Find Them

There are seven regular and three guaranteed Alpha Pokemon in Wild Zone 15 in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . They are:

Pumpkaboo

Shuppet

Haunter

Whirlipede

Scolipede

Beedrill

Larvitar

Alpha Gourgeist

Alpha Beedrill

Alpha Banette

Pumpkaboo Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Pumpkaboo are abundant in Wild Zone 15, and you'll run into them immediately upon entering the area.

Whirlipede Location

  • Time: Day

Whirlipede spawn in the bushes on the west side of Wild Zone 15, in the small garden with the benches, next to the cafe.

Scolipede Location

  • Time: Day

A single Scolipede can be found in the middle of the garden, right next to the benches. However, it is not a confirmed spawn, and you may have to reset the area a couple of times to get it to appear.

Beedrill Location

  • Time: Day

Multiple Beedrill swarm the side of Cafe Ultimo that faces the garden, in the middle of Wild Zone 15. They are highly aggressive but relatively fragile.

Beedrillite is obtained as part of Main Mission 16. You'll already have it in your inventory by this point in the game.

Shuppet Location

  • Time: Night

A single Shuppet spawns in the middle of the garden, near the road. It can be easy to miss among the larger Pokemon, but it does not run away.

Haunter Location

  • Time: Night

Haunter appears in the garden at night, next to the benches.

To evolve Haunter into Gengar, you'll need to trade it with a friend. However, Gengar itself can be captured later in the main story.

Larvitar Location

  • Time: Day/Night

Larvitar is located on the rooftops of Wild Zone 15. However, it is impossible to get to these rooftops from inside the zone. To reach there, you'll first need to unlock the Holovator on the building nearby (shown above) by completing Side Mission 80: A Shocking Territorial Dispute .

Side Mission 80 only unlocks in Main Mission 26: An Invitation From the SBC . During this mission, you'll need to visit a boutique to get a fashionable suit to go to the SBC event. Once you have acquired this suit, Side Mission 80 will appear next to the Holovator's location.

Complete Side Mission 80 by defeating the Manectric and Ampharos blocking the Holovator, and you'll be able to make it functional. Use the Holovator to teleport to the top of the building, then turn left and destroy the spider web sac to form a web bridge. Cross the bridge and enter Wild Zone 15's rooftop gate to find Larvitar.

Alpha Gourgeist Location

  • Time: Day/Night

A level 52 Alpha Gourgeist spawns near the eastern edge of Wild Zone 15, close to the boundary wall.

Alpha Beedrill Location

  • Time: Day

A level 52 Alpha Beedrill appears among the swarm of regular Beedrill, easy to spot thanks to its bright red eyes.

Alpha Banette Location

  • Time: Night

A level 53 Alpha Banette appears directly in the middle of the garden at night.

Banettite is obtained as a reward for completing Main Mission 18 and should already be in your possession.

52
4.8 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Best Open-World Games That Perfectly Balance Combat And Exploration
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring offers unparalleled variety, with rewards hidden across a colossal world for hundreds of hours of exciting gameplay.
  • STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl features dangers in a unique open-world environment, rewarding exploration with dynamically respawning artifacts.
  • The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt sets a new course for the genre with adventure, diverse monsters, and distractions in combat, despite aging mechanics.

Open-world games are among the most popular in the gaming landscape, drawing millions of players. With their combination of freedom, breadth of gameplay mechanics, and available activities, and the allure of playing at one's own pace, open-world titles usually support various playstyles and provide players with different incentives to stay in their worlds.

While many open-world games may lean toward either exploration or combat, numerous titles successfully blend them equally, without a clear prevalence of one over the other. Exploring the surroundings, unraveling secrets, and searching for ways to reach hidden loot are often as exciting as being ambushed or cutting one's way through enemies to claim a reward. Below are some of the most notable open-world games available today that perfectly balance combat and exploration.

Elden Ring

Unparalleled Variety In Everything

Elden Ring
10 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Elden Ring takes everything great about FromSoftware's signature gameplay formula and places it in a truly colossal, breathtaking, layered world unlike anything players have explored before. Naturally, players can visit any corner of the Lands Between they can lay their eyes on, and everywhere they'll find rewards worth claiming, although some are hidden so well that few players may ever discover them.

Anything found in the world can be used on the battlefield, including hundreds of armor pieces, various weapons, tools, spells, and more. Coupled with enemy variety as wild as Elden Ring 's, as well as incredibly strong level design and enemy placement, the game stays exciting, unpredictable, and rewarding for hundreds of hours.

STALKER 2: Heart Of Chornobyl

Environment Full Of Dangers Of All Sorts

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl
28
8.5 /10
Released
November 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Intense Violence, Blood, Use Of Drugs And Alcohol, Language, Crude Humor
Powered by

STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl remains faithful to the original STALKER games, offering an unpredictable and dangerous open-world environment of the Zone, ripe for exploration. From countless well-hidden stashes left by other wanderers containing the best gear, to precious artifacts that respawn dynamically after random emissions and require considerable effort to find, exploration in STALKER 2 is in a league of its own.

Of course, some of the biggest dangers in the Zone aren't anomalies at all, but rather deadly mutants, other stalkers, or bandits. Players can be ambushed unpredictably by enemy groups, and while STALKER 2 has had its issues with the promised A-Life system failing to deliver, each new update has made the game better, and gunplay is already as strong as fans could hope for.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Laying A New Course For The Genre

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

Few open-world games of the past decade have had an impact as strong as The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt , a title that earned countless awards and worldwide recognition for mastering the open-world RPG formula. The game's beautiful multi-region world is brimming with adventure and discoveries, while its diverse monster bestiary keeps things fresh for dozens, if not hundreds, of hours.

While The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt 's combat system is already showing its age, there's still plenty of fun to be had for those willing to experiment and use everything in Geralt's arsenal. Reaching a destination in The Witcher 3 is rarely a straightforward task, as players are constantly distracted by hidden treasures, small side quests, and combat encounters.

Ghost Of Tsushima

Keen Eye & Deadly Sword

Ghost of Tsushima
9 /10
44
8.9 /10
Released
July 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Partial Nudity
Powered by

Ghost of Tsushima seemingly adopts the Ubisoft-style approach to an open-world environment, but thanks to several unique ideas from Sucker Punch, it manages to stand apart. Exploration rarely requires checking the map for directions, as players can look for visual clues and follow animals or the wind to the next point of interest, not to mention how arrestingly beautiful the world of Tsushima is.

While the variety of map activities could be better, Ghost of Tsushima 's combat system more than compensates. With intricate progression that grants new moves and tricks until the very end, and a streamlined approach to gear, fighting Mongols is never boring. Add to that random encounters like roaming enemy patrols, bandit ambushes, and wandering ronin looking for Jin, and the game becomes a well-oiled mechanism perfectly mixing the best the genre has to offer.

Fallout 4

True Paradise For Looters

Fallout 4
9 /10
54
8.9 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M FOR MATURE: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, STRONG LANGUAGE, USE OF DRUGS
Powered by

Fallout 4 is defined by its intricate balance between exploration and combat. The vast map of Boston and its surroundings is almost entirely available from the beginning, as players make their way toward any interesting landmark they might spot in the distance. Quite literally every step of the way is worth careful examination, as Fallout 4 is packed with rewarding secrets, missable areas like entire underground bases, and countless examples of Bethesda's environmental storytelling.

Yet, traditionally for the series, the wasteland is a dangerous place where looters, raiders, robots, and mutants can suddenly ambush unfortunate travellers at every corner. Try to get a well-hidden item, and players will most likely trigger a trap that brings unwanted attention. Luckily, Fallout 4 's combat is arguably the best in the series to date, and coupled with a robust crafting system, players can use any scrap found while exploring to great benefit in combat.

Assassin's Creed Origins

The Witcher 3, But With Pyramids

Assassin's Creed Origins
8.6 /10
Released
October 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Ever since its shift to an open-world action-RPG blueprint, Assassin's Creed games have typically delivered on both combat and exploration, so it often comes down to each player's preference for the setting. However, Assassin's Creed Origins deserves a special place for its intricate balance between the two, elevated by the unique and captivating setting of Ancient Egypt.

Exploring once-remarkable cities, religious temples, vast deserts, and even the Great Pyramids themselves is memorable on its own and often rewards players with powerful gear. And there's no shortage of chances to put that gear to use in Origins , as players work to clear Egypt of corrupting influences, battle undead pharaohs, or even participate in events like gladiator arenas, fighting menacing foes such as War Elephants, or challenging the Gods themselves.

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Expansive & Fun, If Slightly Controversial

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Powered by

Standing among the best open-world games of recent times, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth spectacularly expands on the original with updated direction. Not only is the game massive, but almost every element brings something new to the table — from combat and exploration to quests and mini-games — keeping the experience fresh even for long-time fans.

In Rebirth , players rarely need to engage in combat just for the sake of it, allowing for a natural balance between free-form exploration, side activities and mini-games, and intense combat encounters and boss fights.

Interestingly, despite its highs, FF7 Rebirth still ended up being quite divisive for its approach to both exploration and combat. Some veteran JRPG fans are not fully satisfied with its hybrid combat system (real-time battles with strategic elements), which can feel a bit too punishing, and they describe the exploration of later regions as repetitive and formulaic.
